content_parts.title: Bill of material and work order component default sequence numbers

content_parts.content:
You asked. We listened.

Bills of material provide the default value of 10 as the start number for sorting an ascending sequence of components. The default for each subsequent component is in increments of 10 so that you can insert components and instructions into the sequence if necessary.
When you add components after creating a work order, the same default sequence applies. Subsequent component numbers increase by 10 automatically.

For main lists and inquiry pages, save time by creating and saving custom views. After customizing your list, give your view a unique name and save it so you can recall it at any time. You can create as many views as needed.

You also have the option to modify an existing view or create a new view based on an existing view.

You can save standard display options to:

  • Pin, hide, or display columns
  • Change the order of columns
  • Apply a filter to one or several columns
  • Sort and group lines

content_parts.content:
Retry failed posting

When posting is unsuccessful, you can use the Retry icon on the Posting tab to access the Notification history page. From there, you can resolve errors, such as missing dimensions, and easily resend or retry the posting as needed.

This enhancement applies to posting transactions for purchase receipts; stock adjustments, receipts, value changes, counts, and stock issue; and sales credit memos.

View status

To see the journal posting status, the Posting tab was added to completed documents for sales shipments and work orders.

After uploaded documents are scanned by Sage’s AI-powered assistant and ready to be reviewed, you can select and confirm multiple documents simultaneously, streamlining your workflow. You can no longer edit fields populated from an uploaded purchasing document for purchase invoices and credit memos to ensure consistency.

In addition, create and update information displays on the main list and the single document page for easier tracking.

content_parts.content:
Forms

You can create 2 forms for stock transfer shipments:

  • Pick lists to improve efficiency and ensure accuracy when picking items during the shipment preparation process.
  • Packing slips to provide a clear view of the items included in the shipment.

Inquiries

You can use the Stock in transit inquiry page to generate a report for a specific date, enabling accurate reconciliation of the GL account associated with in-transit stock transfer records.

The inquiry only includes records created after this release. Transactions before this release are not included in the results.
